q: other papers Claims phone-hacking row involves other papers Calls for police inquiry into Andy Coulson The former editor of the paper said in a recent statement that he believed claims about illegal hacking under his editorship meant he could not give the 110% needed , for his role as Downing Street communications chief. Despite accepting responsibility for the illegal activities, Mr Andy Coulson strongly denies knowing they were taking place and a Scotland Yard investigation resulted in no further charges.

He said he was disappointed in the president's budget proposal. This senator will do everything he can to make sure that the budget is not balanced on the backs of the weak, the vulnerable, the sick or the old who can't afford to heat their homes in the winter, he said. "This is simply wrong," added Rep. Peter Welch ( D-Vt.). "We must not balance the budget at the expense of Vermonters struggling to heat their homes in winter.

Auditions for US contestants begin on 27 March in Los Angeles. Other sessions follow in Chicago, Dallas, Miami, Seattle and New York. Talking at a news conference Simon Cowell said: The top contestant will get$ 1 million(? 619,000) a year for five years, separate from the costs involved in recording and promotion. "It's a massive, massive risk but it's also an incredible incentive. It puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure. "I believe I can find a star. But he admitted: "If they don't sell a single record they still get to keep the money. It is pressure, because if the wrong person wins, I'm in trouble.
